text: does doing something like  `{% set disabled_caching = request.cookies %}` to disable page caching still work?

are you trying to permanently disable caching for that page? or just for when you're testing? Personally for testing I use the HubSpot dev extension: <https://github.com/GonzaloTorreras/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/wiki/So-you're-having-HubSpot-Caching-Issues%3F>

and might I suggest using <https://github.com/GonzaloTorreras/HubSpot-Developer-Extension/tree/v2|v2>. You have to install it manually, but It has some <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CCQ7H31D5/p1708799515182749?thread_ts=1691523478.661799&cid=CCQ7H31D5|new features> AND works (kinda) with the new menu
oh hell yeah <@UATE4ATHP> didn't know you build a v2 version! that's so sick, I'm going to start playing with it. Appreciate all your work here
:muscle::skin-tone-2: its very much a beta. So it may break :upside_down_face: my fav thing is the custom dev menu
yeah that looks absolutely sick, I was just digging into the code to see how you were doing that. Duping the menu element and just replacing the innerHTML?
the styles keep breaking everytime HS changes the nav. Cuz the class names change lol
Guess i need to code the styles into it
lol bro I have built so many of the same things, I had a chrome extension for extending the HubSpot contact action bar (create task, send email, etc) and the classname thing was the worst!
granted my code was a lot shittier then this, you're awesom!
yeah every time they compile something, its generates new random classes.
To answer you question Jhon, in theory yes. Though I can't confirm

does anyone know how to route delivery of a form submission to a specific user, and only that user? I’ve not successfully delivered a %form% to anyone other than the default recipient using notifications_override_email_addresses - is there some other way?

You got HubL questions?  <https://www.linkedin.com/posts/dennisedson_mastering-hubl-from-basics-to-advanced-techniques-activity-7196935494285279233-1XLg?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop|the DHUG has HubL answers> :sunglasses:
what i meant was disable caching for live pages, thanks!
